metadata.title: CVE-2023-4004 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel's netfilter in the waya user triggers the nft_pipapo_remove function with the element, without aNFT_SET_EXT_KEY_END. This issue could allow a local user to crash thesystem or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4004` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-31-generic - 6.2.0-31.31
linux-image-6.2.0-31-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-31-generic - 6.2.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-31-generic-64k - 6.2.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-kvm - 6.2.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-aws - 6.2.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-azure - 6.2.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1012-gcp - 6.2.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1008-ibm - 6.2.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1011.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1011-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-oracle - 6.2.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1011-raspi - 6.2.0-1011.13
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1003-starfive - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-31.31').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1011.11').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.10').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.10').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1012.12').
linux-ibm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1008.8').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1011.11').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1010.10').
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1011.13').
linux-starfive package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
